website_summaries.verdict: Compound anvil loppers are often better with thicker branches and saplings than the traditional scissor-like bypass models. This is an excellent choice for users with limited arm strength.
pros: Cuts larger branches more easily than bypass loppers
Anvil design provides more leverage for smaller users
Detachable blades easy to replace when dull
Carbon steel blade with comfort grips
cons: Handles are hollow, can bend over time
Difficult to open in tight spaces

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money unless you’re Just using these to cut your roses
customer_reviews.text: The blades were great and would cut through just about anything. The handles however won’t handle anything more than about an inch in thickness. Bent in half after an hour of use. I wouldn’t think a 52-year-old woman would be able to bend metal handles... What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Marlena Shaw

customer_reviews.title: This Lopper is an Animal
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 fruit trees. Pruning time is not something I look forward to. My previous bypass pruners had difficulty going through larger branches and often did not make clean cuts. This lopper is an animal, and cuts through very large branches relatively easy. It always makes clean cuts. I used it for all size branches, large and small, because it could handle everything and did a cleaner job. They seem to be very good quality. I worked them really hard and no signs of damage or wear so far.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well but need to secure anvil.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on mesquite until nuts holding anvil in place loosened and anvil was lost. Replacenet blade available on Amazon but not replacement anvil. Contacted Tabor on their website and they provided replacement anvil. If you purchase, recommend Loctite on anvil bolts or replacing standard nuts with locking nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Will B

customer_reviews.title: This is now my "go-to" lopper
customer_reviews.text: I have used various loppers over the years, but this one is my first anvil type lopper. I had no idea what I was missing. Cutting with this tool just seems easier and cleaner, especially for dry wood and thicker branches. I purchased a new bypass lopper at the same time I bought this anvil lopper, and although the bypass lopper works great, I found myself leaving the bypass lopper on the ground and using this anvil lopper 95% of the time. It's sturdy, solid, and strikes me as very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Longevity?
customer_reviews.text: Tool worked well for a few weeks in a residential landscape Maintenance business. The blade shattered in half when trying to chop a 1.5" branch in half. Would like to know about warranty on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Glyn

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular Tool.
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular Tool, put it to the test right away with a huge pile of branches left over from Hurricane Irma, made quick work of all those branches, 2" plus thick, couldn't be happier. I was in between getting the Fiskers, Corona(very familiar with the corona, my BF has one and I've used it many times, and its great) and this Tabor Lopper, but I am so happy I went with my instincts and that 92% 5 Star review was hard to get past. It's a few bucks more but well worth the extra cost, truly a fantastic tool. Light Weight, Smooth Cutting, almost effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto L Torna

customer_reviews.title: These are well worth the purchase price and I recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.text: My previous loppers (of another brand) lasted 20 years but finally gave up the ghost so these were going to be tough shoes to fill. I put them to the test right away. I had topped out some mature crepe myrtle trees and had a lot of thick branches to cut. The GG12'S handled the task effortlessly. They are well constructed and heavy duty without being difficult to yield. These are well worth the purchase price and I recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Broke day 1
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cut evergreens and the Blade snapped fight off TABOR TOOLS GG12 Compound Action Anvil Lopper,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend these. I also loved the fact that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to trim the bamboo in our back yard. We have tried several other garden tools but it was always such a chore. These arrived quickly and when I used them for the first time, I had all of the bamboo trimmed and thinned in about 45 minutes! I couldn't believe it. I would highly recommend these. I also loved the fact that I received an email from Tabor Tools before the loppers arrived and it contained a fantastic guide on how to properly trim and prune trees. I would definitely purchase more tools made by Tabor.
customer_reviews.author: MARIAN WAKEFIELD

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank, cuts with ease.......Add on review for second one bought....
customer_reviews.text: "Tried it out, it works great, I knew it would after reading all the positive feedbacks....Cut limbs with ease, much better than I could have imagined....I started to buy another brand, but after reading the feedbacks on this one, it was a no brainer....Built like a tank....I have bought other brands in the past, they all broke, I think this one will last a lifetime... " Second review....My neighbor borrowed mine, he had to have one...I told him he could borrow mine....No, he had to have one for himself....Any negative reviews should be dismissed, this one will last a lifetime...Some reviewer said sent it back because of a hollow handle, handle will out last you....
customer_reviews.author: Healthy 1

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy duty as they claim.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first two afternoons I used it. The blade broke on the Friday afternoon so couldn’t finish my project that weekend. Looks really heavy duty so not sure why the blade broke real easy. I’ve got an old branch cutter from craftsman’s and I’ve used that one a lot rougher and it’s still cuts today. Now I’m trying to figure out if they sell replacement blades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big disappoinment!
customer_reviews.text: We had planned on using these loopers to clean up shrubbery around the home we just purchased. However, they broke the very first time we used them. We were going to trim the suckers that were growing on some fruit trees. A "chunk" of the blade literally broke off. Like the blades were not hardened or ?? Very disappointed because we were under the impression they were a good quality. Unfortunately, we were so busy at the time, I didn't write this review until now. My bad. But hopefully people will read this and purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.author: M. French

customer_reviews.title: One Minor Flaw Otherwise Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Really cuts well. I've made over 100 cuts in the two days since I received them and it cuts very well. One minor problem though. The bolts that hold the cutting head on are not long enough that a nut can hold them on from the other side. One fell out, but I didn't loose it. About every 15 minutes you need to tighten with your hand. I am going to try and find a longer bolt that I can secure better with a nut from the other side of the cutting head.
customer_reviews.author: John Bailey

customer_reviews.title: So Far Great!
customer_reviews.text: My loppers arrived today so I immediately put them to a test. Mind you I'm a 5'1" 72 yr old grandmother. Within 15 min. I had a mountain of dead branches including a 4' tall dead Mungho Pine. Tons of dead Staghorn Sumac branches. Every cut was on wood that ranged from 1.5"-2". The only thing that stopped me was a 2" oak sapling on the side of a hill however my 79 yr old husband made short work of it. These are by far the best loppers I every used going back nearly 50 yrs gardening. They seem sturdy so my hope is that they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Moore

customer_reviews.title: I bought two in recent years and they work great. But i should advise you to not cut ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool can cut! it cuts branches, small trees, small bushes, big vines, and even soft vines that are hard to cut with small cutters.I bought two in recent years and they work great.But i should advise you to not cut anything too wide,I did and it bent the blade and it cuts wrong now.SO DON'T OVER DO IT.Just don't get carried away and over do it like i did and risk bending it out of whack.I did it on my second pair and i'm regretting it because the lopper is not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: A.M

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Didn't Know Cutting Trees Was So Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Got these to cut down two large sapling tulip trees. On my way to cut, I managed to trip and fall hard, injuring my back. Cut the biggest -- it was way easier than cutting butter! (You've cut cold butter?) My two trees turned out to be two woods, with several at least an inch in diameter. Five minutes later, I was thinking of pruning elsewhere, but decided to care for my back. Felt like 5 stars. Thought it needed a bit more than a five minute outing. I am a short, out of shape, weak 77 year old female.
customer_reviews.author: Biblioholic

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase EVER. I’d been quoted $300+ for an arborist to come out and trim my overgrown Bradford Pear (I know, I know. I didn’t plant it). I figured I would give these a whirl first. WOW. They make trimming SO easy. I am an average-sized woman at 5’8, not particularly atheletic, and I trimmed the hell out of my tree. Using a saw would have taken hours, and I probably didn’t spend more than 30 minutes on the first trim session. It’s summer in Texas so I am doing a little at a time. I also used them on my neighbor’s overgrown shrubs encroaching on my yard, which was a piece of cake. Clean cuts every time.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I was dreading a project to cut back a heavily over grown hibiscus bush. It had become a 12 foot tree. Took me no longer than 30 minutes to take it back down to 8 feet and to shape it. This lopper cut through old wood like it was butter. I am 70 years old and don’t have the strength I used to. Can’t believe how easy this tool made each cut. Worth every dollar spent!
customer_reviews.author: M. Babette Besselievre

customer_reviews.title: Tabor Anvil Lopper
customer_reviews.text: When I open the box, it appeared a little heavy to me. I am a petite woman so can't really complain until I use it. I tried on weekend and it worked so well I kept trimming and end up finished most trees in my backyard. It is a little heavy for me if I have to lift it up to cut the branch but still workable. I did not get sore arms the next day so it is a good sign. It is a little difficult for me to cut the 2" branch but I bet my son and my husband can cut it without any problem. Overall, I am very happy I got this lopper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The BEST pair of loppers we've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: So, my wife, who does most the yard work, told me she needed a "good" pair of loppers - at 60+ years of age, she was tired of trying to cut branches that were overmatched by the numerous loppers we'd bought over the years. So, I researched reviews and ended up buying this one from Tabor Tools. WOW, simply THE BEST pair of loppers we've ever used - extremely impressed with how easily they cut, and the handles being slightly longer that all the previous pairs we've owned, provide the necessary leverage for the really thick stuff. My wife loves them and guess that's what counts!!
customer_reviews.author: Bogey

customer_reviews.title: Strong anvil lopper!
customer_reviews.text: These are great if expensive anvil loppers. They were bought in 2016 and nothing, nothing has broken, bent or otherwise damaged. The handles are not round and not very large so someone with big mitts may not think they're so great. When I've used them to cut near the size limit of the tool its better to put the anvil side on the ground and push down with the blade. That keeps the pressure on the branch with no twisting. Even so the lopper might groan and squeal. If such a larger branch is still on the tree or bush its better to saw it off.
customer_reviews.author: datarush

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool to have!
customer_reviews.text: I’m impressed! I went outside the other day and cut close to 30 tree saplings in like 20 minutes! Some of them were about an inch and a half in diameter too! The smaller ones cut like butter! These saved me a lot of time! I was sawing the trees by hand before and my old loppers just couldn’t do it! I will update this post if I have any problems but I have to say that these loppers are well made and handle well! I’m looking forward to seeing what else I can do with them!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A. LaBelle

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Blade broke on the 8th branch that I tried to cut. Less than 1/2 diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very good heavy duty lopper for larger branches
customer_reviews.text: A very good heavy duty lopper for larger branches. I have to clear an acre of land and my old one wore out after many years. The only downside of this one compared with my old one: The old one had round handles, this one has flat sides on the handles where you grip it. I could get a better grip on the round one. This one is still fine, but if I had a choice of 2 and the only difference was the handle shape I would prefer the rounded handles.
customer_reviews.author: W. Steward

customer_reviews.title: Skip the rest
customer_reviews.text: I run through at least one set of the aluminum extension-handled units every season after pollarding fruitless Mullberries and pruning my modest property. The handles always seem to snap at the spot welds. These fiberglass handled, well designed units are 100x better, never feel 'weak' and give a solid grip. I particularly like the wider mouth (2") and smooth, serviceable/replaceable action. I would say that I would buy again... but I don't think I will have to. Worth the extra $$. [These Kibutznicks got this figured out better than most. This is my 3rd Tabor tool. I love them all.]
customer_reviews.author: Friedmanagain

customer_reviews.title: Good for cutting saplings and suckers
customer_reviews.text: Having the extra reach and leverage with this long-handled lopper is helpful for cutting saplings hiding at the back of the flower bed. So far, the thickest branch I've cut through has been one inch in diameter, which the lopper handled with no problem. I haven't attempted any two-inch-diameter branches, and would probably still use a tree saw for those. With large branches the difficulty is getting the anvil and blade into the proper angle and position for cutting. Also the larger the branch, the more strength required. Overall a good lopper that I'd recommend for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Allen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cut with Tabor
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase of Loppers and Pruning Shears. The next neighbor and I share a hedge in the property line and he was using an electric trimmer to cut hedge. It nearly destroyed the hedge because it cut so rough. With these Tabor pruning shears and loppers, the difference was amazing. Takes a little more time, but well worth it! Highly recommend Tabor.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: These are the first set of anvil style lopper that I've bought and i don't think I'll go back to bypass ever again. For small stuff these work as good as any I've used and for but stuff, they're far better. The quality of these particular lopper seems good as well. I've had them a couple years and use them occasionally. So far, no problems of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: I am in Lopper heaven.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lopper I have ever seen. My neighbors yard is bordered by a forest of Buckthorns trees that creep into my property. The tree trunks and branches are extremely hard to prune BUT not with this lopper. It slices thru 2" round branches and trunks easily. I am in my 70's and it is very easy for me to prune this invasive species.
customer_reviews.author: EdB

customer_reviews.title: review of loppers
customer_reviews.text: If you need a lopper that is big and will cut 1 1/2" branches without a problem this will do it. I am not sure how long this product will last but for the money it was a good purchase. It cuts well . In the past I have had fancier ratchet style loppers (that were physically smaller and you need to apply an easy pumping action to make the cut), this lopper is simple it just cuts the branch. I don't think one is less effective than the other, one is just larger than the other. Also, because it is simple there is less to break.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lum

customer_reviews.title: Robust and Rugged
customer_reviews.text: While I've only used the tool once, a reader of this review might think I'm a bit presumptuous to give the product a 5-star review, given the short time that I've had the tool. Regardless, this tool is rugged, robust, and worth the money several times over. I worked through a dead tree with ease and enjoyment while this machine cut through the dead limbs with little effort. Good product. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: K-Pi

customer_reviews.title: Getting the job done
customer_reviews.text: The loppers came when expected and in a timely manner. While a bit heavier and longer than I expected, they did cut through the bushes I needed to reduce. Blade was sharp and did a great job. I was able to easily cut through branches that were at least an inch in diameter. It seems like a product that will hold up for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: HelenBH713

customer_reviews.title: Tough to get a nice close cut and the cuts were not as clean ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well made loppers.Somewhat large and clumsy to use on smaller branches. Tough to get a nice close cut and the cuts were not as clean as I'd hoped for. For the size of branches this lopper is good for, I'll stick with my pruning saw or break out my Dewalt reciprocating saw. I did think enough of the quality and construction of this Tabor Tools Lopper to order their GG11 Bypass Lopper that arrived today. Happy Pruning!
customer_reviews.author: Smitty66

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through small branches like butter
customer_reviews.text: I have a property that was left growing wild for 12 years before I got it. I kept trying other loppers, kinds you could get at Home Depot and your standard hardware stores and nothing was cutting it. I found this tool and saw the excellent reviews and decided to give it a shot. They are solid loppers, lightweight and easy to use and require little finagling to get through smaller branches. Nice clean cuts, my yard looks amazing. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Audioinertia

customer_reviews.title: "VERY SHARP AND EASY TO USE!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! The 2" size is a must. So good for trimming all my bougainvillea that had gotten over 20 ft tall and over 2 inch around. A lot less stabbing of the giant thorns using these loppers that cut through like butter!" It was so easy and kind of fun that I went around and trimmed everything in my yard. They are not too heavy and are so easy to use. And a great price!
customer_reviews.author: S. CUSHMAN

customer_reviews.title: Best Lopper I have bought in a while
customer_reviews.text: I bought a lopper at a chain home center one fall. I didn't use it until spring and it broke the first time I used it. The warranty was out, so I bought another one. That one broke on the second cut. I returned the lopper and got a refund. I bought this one and its still going and on the second spring use of it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: this truly cuts 2" limbs as advertised! i chose ...
customer_reviews.text: this truly cuts 2" limbs as advertised! i chose it over some other competitors because it does not require me to open the handles very far to trim wild bushes is close quarters. i use it for trail maintenance in the National Forest.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Warrick

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for our tree branches and all around trim for the yard
customer_reviews.text: We just moved into a new home and needed something that really cut thru tree branches for trimming. we looked around and we found these on Amazon after going to several stores and looking around. So glad we purchased these. They do a bang up job and are really not heavy. My husband said they were easy to use than what he had thought. They come really packaged nice with a cover for the cutting area and when we received the package it was packed nicely. For the price and quality it was a great find.
customer_reviews.author: Evanston

customer_reviews.title: Effective Tool Update
customer_reviews.text: When you need a large capacity loper, this tool fits the bill. I have used it a lot since I received it and it works great. It is a relatively heavy tool (light for its size) to handle but the cutting action is smooth and quick. The cuts are clean. I am taking down some pine tress and I use this tool to strip the medium size branches up to 2 inches. I strongly recommend this product. Update: Six months of hard use and this tool stands up to heavy use. I am totally satisfied with its performance and I have tested its limits.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rohy

customer_reviews.title: It really does cut a 2" branch
customer_reviews.text: When I took the product out of the box I was skeptical. It did not have a curved blade like my 20 yr old lopper had and I wasn't sure it would do the job. I was pleasantly surprised when it sliced right through the smallest branch up to a 2 in branch. It is also much lighter and easier to handle than my old lopper and is well constructed. Glad I listened to the reviews and bought this one instead of another I was looking at.
customer_reviews.author: cruella

customer_reviews.title: High quality lopper shears
customer_reviews.text: These lopper shears are high quality and cut like butter on 2 inch branches. Much better than my old worn out loppers that I purchased years ago at Job Lot. They are pricier than some other competitors, but what sold me is the availability of replacement blades and the great customer service. Tabor even emailed me a couple of times with info on how to properly prune. I appreciate the attention to the customer and Tabor wants to be sure you're happy with your purchase. You can feel confident making this purchase. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: J Berton

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Expected to actually cut 2 inch fresh branches. No way. Blade twists to one side under load. Actually bent. Requires brute force. Not nearly enough mechanical advantage to do the job. Jaws close at very similar angle to handles. Advertised to cut dry branches as well. Dry branches are much harder to cut. Not nearly a professional tool. Requested a return after 10 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.author: David Sheriff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t pretend to be an expert on this type of tool, but I’ve owned a few of these over the years. It just came in about thirty minutes ago and I out it to work right away. It’s easily cutting through limbs that are two inches in diameter. I’m totally satisfied because it easily fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Roger K. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit it, I'm cheap and these loppers aren't necessarily what I would think of as inexpensive. I bought anvil loppers on closeout @ Tractor Supply, for half what I paid for these. They were heavy, inconvenient to use, and a piece was bent, after one afternoon of use. They went back the next day. I spent the next month or so,researching what to buy, that I wouldn't have to take back. Ended up buying these. You know the terms "hot knife thru butter" and "pleasure to use"? Both apply to these loppers. A bargain isn't necessarily a bargain, if you just look at price. I consider these a bargain, assuming they hold up as I expect.
customer_reviews.author: Roy S Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent loppers for the price
customer_reviews.text: To start, I’m 70 years old. I tackled my first project today with my new GG12A Anvil Lopper with Compound Action. It performed flawlessly. I cut 1” to 1 1⁄4” branches easily. I’m sure it can handle larger branches as well. They feel very solid. I’m looking forward to using these loppers for many years to come. They are not lightweight, but they are well made. I appreciate that the company has provided instructions for proper maintenance and sharpening. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: White Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: A superior tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful, strong tool. It’s a little heavy, but the long handles adds greatly to reach and therefore speeds up work time. The hook on the end of the anvil is a great innovation and helps to hook the branch to be cut. Lastly, the clear cut of the anvil Is far superior to shear cuts
customer_reviews.author: Ed's Shop

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but cuts easily
customer_reviews.text: I have to prune my full sized apple tree and I bought the lopper to do it. I am a small person and they are heavier than I anticipated, so it is a bit hard for me to reach up or lean out with them, BUT I must say that they make the actual cutting very easy. I am able to trim at least one inch branches with very little effort, so I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Maureenrf

customer_reviews.title: Impeckable Service staff & quality limb cutter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this GG12A limb cutter in Feb - 2018, used it extensively on my 12 acres clearing small sapling overgrowth. In May-2020 (2) of the cutter head bolts needed replacing, I emailed support at Tabor Tools and support immediately responded to my needs even though the covid-19 virus quarantine was/in effect. The support staff told me approximately when I would be receiving the parts, the parts arrived earlier than expected. For me the GG12A cuts easily, is light weight and the service is impeccable. I will purchase again from Tabor Tools,
customer_reviews.author: Don E.

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: These are really heavy duty and a pleasure to use. My old pair had been sharpened numerous times over the years and had some alignment problems because of it. These make a perfectly clean cut every time with minimal straining. They’re a great upgrade to my tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: rtk11226

customer_reviews.title: Redemption for a great tool and company!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool but it was ultimately defeated by acacia on the island of Montserrat, Sustaining a 1.5 cm fracture of the cutting blade. I attempted to buy a replacement blade from Tabor but it was not available. They replaced the entire tool without any question! I would gladly buy this tool again! Please ignore my unhappy posting of a week or so ago. Good tool, good company! Dan
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy them.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic loppers! I based my purchase of these based upon the reviews, and I was tired of battling with my 20 year old ones that were dull. I have decreased strength in one arm due to surgery so I need to choose my tools wisely. I put these to use about 10 minutes after unboxing. These are solid, I was able to cut through thick zombie locust re-growth with ease. My other loppers are going to make a trip to the metal recycling plant to be turned into something new. These make yard work easier.
customer_reviews.author: V. H.

customer_reviews.title: STRONG!
customer_reviews.text: I've got three acres of trees and shrubs to deal with. I tend to break more pruners and loppers than most people due to how much I use them. This tool is strong, cuts well, and has a good balance of weight for everything I do. Don't buy those cheap ones, get this one instead.
customer_reviews.author: MrE

customer_reviews.title: These are great and well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: These are great and well worth the cost. I compared them to my old, regular loppers (same length tool) on several branches around 2" in diameter and the Tabor's sliced right through without much effort where the standard loppers didn't make a dent. Reasonably light and nimble too. The tip has a little hook to help you make full cuts every time and the handles don't need to open too far to get a full 2" branch into the jaws. I highly recommend these if you have substantial heavy-duty jobs you want to make light work of.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Maksimik

customer_reviews.title: Highly endorse this Tabor GG12 tool.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased my second GG12 Tabor Lopper. Mine works fine so I bought one as a gift for my yardman who really likes the first one I have" I am over 90 and don't have a lot of arm strength so this design makes it easy to use and although I have my yard man using it, there is always something that needed clipped so for the ladies who do a "little" yard work, you will like using his one. Alex.B
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Best overall of all I have bought
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I hesitated to spend the extra money for these. I have always bought the cheaper brands from the local discount hardware stores. WOW - was I surprised! These cut sooooo much better. Great ergonomics and the blade cut through my one inch branches as if they were made of butter! So happy with these! I will now spend the extra time to make sure they are stored out of the weather. I doubt I will ever need another pair, but if I did, I would buy this model in a minute! Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Laurenne J.

customer_reviews.title: Compound action helps a lot, cutter strong enough
customer_reviews.text: Loaned them to a friend (weightlifter guy) who uses FORCE to overcome issues (like too big of a branch to be cutting with loppers and should have used a saw instead). I was impressed that the unit survived, joints still tight, nothing bent.
customer_reviews.author: Standard Customer

customer_reviews.title: great so far, but good luck snipping 2" branches
customer_reviews.text: These are a big step up from the bargain loppers I've been picking up at Lowe's over the years. It is true what some other reviewers say about cutting a 2" branch....it's not like a quick snip. If you're a body builder, perhaps it will be, but it takes me a lot of twisting and squeezing and cursing to get through anything approaching 2".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Loper For Trimming Tree Limbs
customer_reviews.text: This is the best loper I've ever bought. It happens to be my third loper in 48 years but the first Tabor. I wish I had one of these 48 years ago since it is so easy to clip off tree limbs and large shrubs. I can top off tree limbs then chain saw the trunk. Yeah I'm an old woman and I can use these with ease!!
customer_reviews.author: Trapper

customer_reviews.title: Great for Women!
customer_reviews.text: I loved how easy it was to cut thicker branches and limbs. As a women, I had such a hard time having enough strength to use cutting/trimming shears. The lopper made it so easy! You just squeeze. Mine are about 24 to 30 inch long handles and was easy to maneuver out in front of me and allowed me to reach limbs higher up. I love it! by the way, I am not a big woman, 150 pounds, 5'3" and 75 years old. However, I do lift weight, swim, bike etc. but never had much hand and arm strength.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Very Industrial Tool!
customer_reviews.text: When this tool arrived by FedEx, I couldn't believe the size of it and nearly returned it. However, my husband decided to use it to trim small branches from the tree in our front yard. I have used it to trim a bush as well as grape vines from my perrenial garden.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Moen-Urseth

customer_reviews.title: These things are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have a monster hedge in my yard which is also infested with mulberry upstarts. I've lived there 23 years and this is my third pair of lopers. I wanted to upgrade from the Ace wooden handle lopers. The handles are similar length, the the cutting mechanisms in the Tabor are much more substantial, at least twice the size . There is a big difference in the ease of cutting larger branches. I should have bought these years ago, would have saved me lots of time with better results.
customer_reviews.author: Jim.

customer_reviews.title: Best loppers ever!
customer_reviews.text: These lopper's are fantastic! They have cut through everything I have thrown at them. I have to maintain a couple miles of trails. Anything big enough where these trimmers won't do the job you need a chainsaw for anyway. They are very sharp and easy to use. I have friends that help me out every once in a while. They always ask me where I bought them. I highly recommend these lopper's!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blade snapped after 10 branches
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like a hot knife goes thru butter. Then the blade snapped after 10 Live Oak branches. Broke at the upper attach hole. I wasn't expecting that with the price of this cutter. If I wanted to get hit in the face with half a blade I would have bought a cheap cutter. Anyway it worked great until it let go. The branch that did it in was about an inch and a half around if you were wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Milt

customer_reviews.title: Great solid tool...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this TABOR TOOLS GG12 Anvil Lopper for some time now and it really does cut quite large branches with ease! Its actually a pleasure using these. This lopper is very well made and solid. It won't break anytime in the near (or far) future. I have never had a lopper that can perform anywhere near what this lopper is capable of doing. You WON'T be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom  L.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these loppers. I used them to clear and prune a lot of trees over a week. The hinged anvil design made the job much easier than with more conventional pruning loppers, really reducing the physical effort involved. They are lighter than most and yet seem quite sturdy. I used a pruning saw for diameters over 2-3 inches, but this cut everything else easily. The blade needed some sharpening after many hours of work. Great value for money. I got a second set to have for projects elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Anonyme

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Thought the lopper was heavy but after using for 7 days in a row and 4-6/hrs/day, the lopper is not heavy and does an absolutely great job cutting green and dead limbs. Wish I had spent the money years ago for this tool. Have multiple less expensive loppers that don’t cut as well and need constant repair for handles falling off or not cut all the way through a green branch. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: chasman

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a BEAST
customer_reviews.text: Makes very easy work out of cutting and pruning thick branches, both dry and fresh Some people have mentioned the weight, it's not light but not too heavy. It has to have some weight to perform the way it does
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: Strong, lightweight and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and the smaller 19” Tabor loppers based on the reviews of other users and have not been disappointed. Light weight but strong and breeze through the 1.5” ,(and even bigger), branches and limbs. I’m getting older and have arthritis settling in and so many tools just require too much effort. I still have to work to use these but they are so much easier than my old loppers. I would buy these again! *If you found my review helpful, please let Amazon know by clicking the helpful button below!
customer_reviews.author: DWPT

customer_reviews.title: Tabor Tools GG12 Anvil Loppers Review
customer_reviews.text: Love these loppers! I also own a pair of Fiskars 32 inch Power Gear2 bypass loopers which are awesome, but I will say that the Tabor Tools GG12 anvil loppers are able to cut through slightly thicker branches, especially if they are dry and dead. The other advantage of the Tabor GG12 over the Fiskars PG2 is that the handles don't have to be opened up as wide for max thickness cuts, allowing for easier access between branches. Depending on how well they hold up, they just might become my new "go to" pair of loppers!
customer_reviews.author: Marty F.

customer_reviews.title: Last lopper's I'll ever need to buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. As a disabled vet with limited shoulder and elbow use, these lopper's allow me to cut through 2" saplings and limbs with little effort. Having bad knees and hips as well, the long handles also make it much easier to cut even with the ground. Very well made and not too heavy. With proper care I could see these lasting a life time.
customer_reviews.author: P. Coe

customer_reviews.title: Quallity tool
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find good quality loppers. It seems that most manufacturers have chosen to cheapen their product to chase a price point. I would much prefer to have a quality tool that will last for decades and am happy to pay for that quality. I take care of my tools, this lopper is replacing one that I could not find a replacement jaw for. It was 40 years old. Buy quality and take care of the tool and it will be the least expensive in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Jerriann Z.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool that saves time and reduces effort
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few loppers over the last 10 or so years and they've done the job, with a bit of effort. I was really surprised and pleased how well this lopper cut through small saplings and brush. It made my yard work much easier, reducing the amount of time it took to clear about 3 acres. The item came quickly and was packaged well. If you're looking for a great tool I strongly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Rancourt

customer_reviews.title: Cuts so easily! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This tool cuts branches very easily. The closer the branch is to the base of the blade (further away from the very tip of the tool) the easier the cut will be, and you won't have to apply too much force to make the cut. I'm very happy with this one. Using it to clear the yard of several tree limbs that fell and made a jungle. A+
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is actually more than I wanted to pay for. Even Home Depot Fiskar loppers don't cost this much. but the reviews swayed me and I am glad to say the hype is warranted. Cuts branches with ease. I bought the lighter, smaller duty Tabor lopper with it and the only knock is that both were sent in a box with no padding and the banging of the tools together caused some cosmetic scratches/chips. That aside, purchase was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: Turned 100' of bushes into piles of kindling in just a few hours!
customer_reviews.text: I cleared a 100' long row of 60-year-old bushes in just a few hours. A few of the trunks were at the maximum capacity of the loppers, but they handled the job well. I love using a good tool, and this is a GREAT tool! I love how light and maneuverable it is. Congrats to your engineering folks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through branches like butter!
customer_reviews.text: I had an awesome pair of loppers, but the kids took them and wouldn't bring them back. So I went searching for a replacement. This was the only one I found that looked like it could compare, and even though they were more expensive than most, they work great. Very easy to cut through tough branches and scrub trees. They should last me the rest of my life, but the kids are already eyeing them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Johnson Cowell

customer_reviews.title: Well Balanced - Machine - yeah!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for only 2 hrs so far, therefore, it is possible that I might update this review later...but during the first use - I couldn't be happier. I was able to cut ~2-inch branches easily. Anything less than 2 inch was - quite easy for this Lopper. Based on the construction and weight - I am hoping that it will last at least 10 yrs of regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Mukesh Nyati

customer_reviews.title: 2 Inches ? Easy ! I cut thicker branches with this Lopper - its top quality.
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. We live on 2 Acres of wooded property. Lots of shrubs and trees/ this tool is top notch - it is no wonder the reviews are consistently good. Pricey ? yes - but great value.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: These suck
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the product, the blade is dull and doesn't cut easily. I can get a 1.5 inch one at Home Depot for $39.99 and it cuts better than this one. If I could, I'd give this 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Better pruner can be improved
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp but needs to have a blade sharpening stick included. For thicker limbs need extension arms included that could be attached to give additional leverage. As supplied, it is very good . It has a hook opposite the cutting blade that holds the branch not on other pruners that I have seen. Price was high but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: THESE LOPERS ARE GREAT AND VERY SHARP AND HAVE MUCH MORE CLAMPING FORCE ...
customer_reviews.text: THESE LOPERS ARE GREAT AND VERY SHARP AND HAVE MUCH MORE CLAMPING FORCE THAN MY OLD STYLE PRUNNING SHEARS---MY SON USED THEM TO DO A LOT OF TRIMMING AND LOPING OFF OF A GOOD NUMBER OF SAPLINGS GROWING ALL AROUND MY HOUSE HERE IN GARLAND, TX.--MY SON SCOTT SAID THEY WORK AMAZINGLY WELL--HE GOT THE JOB DONE VERY QUICKLY AND ASKED IF HE COULD BORROW THEM FOR HIS OWN TREE PRUNNING JOB AT HIS HOUSE!!!!URS ALWAYS C H NOWOTNY-HERE IN GARLAND, TX.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra few dollars
customer_reviews.text: The quality is worth the extra money. I've cleared a bunch of brush in a pasture fence to make repairs. For fear of ruining chainsaw chain on old wire I have used them far more than intended. They just keep cutting - lov’em!
customer_reviews.author: Rafter A Cattle Co.

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Tabor Tools purchase and I'm so glad to have found them! I've got eight pussy willow trees and a number of other small trees and shrubs that have been long neglected in my backyard. These have made the what I thought would be difficult process of getting m yard undercontrol actually enjoyable. I've been able to get through most of it, including some rather large branches with relative ease. For most of the medium and small branches I barely have to use any effort to lop them off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am a female that has used several different brands, styles and sizes of loppers. These cut as though they are cutting butter. The ones I have used in the past, required me to use all my strength and be totally exhausted when I was finished. They make cutting thick branches a breeze with very little effort and strength required of me. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: The tool does a good job cutting larger branches. It's solid. It's a little heavy, but I'm also not that strong. I don't think I"m going to find anything like this that does a good job that isn't going to be a little heavy for me. If I can find something with shorter handles, I'll get it, but this is a good tool. I would get it again.
customer_reviews.author: Susanls67

customer_reviews.title: Great Bamboo Cutter
customer_reviews.text: So far, my main use of these loppers is to cut back my way overgrown bamboo hedges. Every cut is clean, and the design allows easy use down to ground level. My gardener has used them successfully to re-shape some too tall shrubbery, also to good effect. I find the handles to be comfortably shaped for easy, repeated use.
customer_reviews.author: LeatherHarold

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for pruning
customer_reviews.text: This lopper is very satisfactory. Use it for pruning trees and shrubs. As I am an older lady it is a little heavy for me. Other than that I am very pleased with it and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: gingham

customer_reviews.title: You won't find a better set of loppers
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought one last year and put it through the wringer. He was regularly cutting branches while claring a fence line that were larger than 2 inches and eventually bent the handle from putting too much pressure on it. They are still usable, but we want another pair that he won't put to extreme conditions. You won't find a better set of loppers!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal D.

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive!!!  High Recommendation...
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with the quality of this tool. It cut through small tree branches like a hot knife through butter. It is made of high quality materials and should give us many years of use. We give it a "High Recommendation". We've already let several neighbors know about it. It ships very quickly and received in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Heward

customer_reviews.title: Strong machine
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a cheaper product at one of the big-box retail stores and couldn't get it to work. Was pleasantly surprised by how good these loppers really do work. Most of what I cut were 1 inch branches and they were quite easy. I did a 2 inch pine bow and it worked great there too. Also did 1.5 inch mountain laurel. this is a tough wood, but they still worked well. Highly recommend. They are professional and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: What a Cutter!
customer_reviews.text: I was very anxious to try this out as soon as I got it out of the box...I tried cutting a 2 inch branch and went through it without any problem. Not sure how thick I can go but will end up trying to cut 2.5-3' branches on some giant bushes we have and I need to cut way down...I don't think I will have any problems cutting with with this...its a beast!!
customer_reviews.author: Big T.

customer_reviews.title: I Can Use Them Myself
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman, 5' 2" and I like to do my own yard work, but I don't have the strength of of man or the height for brute force. These loppers are GREAT! I can use them myself and cut through all the underbrush and small limbs that we have in our yard. This is a very powerful and strong tool for cutting limbs and bushes. I'm so pleased I can do it myself!
customer_reviews.author: Marylouise McVeigh

customer_reviews.title: A 2 year review
customer_reviews.text: I have cut thousands of small locust and hedge trees from our pastures. No other loppers have held up, these are going strong. If the jaws will fit around the tree, it will cut through it, sometimes it takes several tries, but it does the job. A flat cut, close to the ground, is safe for tires. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: David J. Neufeld

customer_reviews.title: Excellent function and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool, the best lopper I've used. Easy to use and lightweight, used it for more than 6 hours straight cutting overgrown Laurel bushes. Cut easily thru both green and dried limbs up to about 2" or so. Would highly recommend and would buy again which will not happen for awhile since the quality so high.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my first compound lopper, I expected a decrease in the force needed to cut larger limbs. I had always used "normal" loppers before, but after shoulder surgery, needed something easier. These loppers dont seem any easier to use than my direct loppers. If you get around a 1.5 inches or so of the limb, it is still fairly difficult to cut. I am still looking for loppers that are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I’m 8 hours into cutting, and they do what the say they are supposed to do!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M T

customer_reviews.title: Great Cutting with Reduced Effort!
customer_reviews.text: I was buying this as a present, and I had recently used a friend's old Fiskars. I was poised to buy their current model, but it has shaky reviews and a lot of the users were saying they were not of the same quality of yore. So I started researching and found out about Tabor. I am so glad I did. We have used the loppers now to cut several limbs that are between an inch and an inch and a half, and they cut smoothly and cleanly. For smaller than an inch, they go through wood like buttah!
customer_reviews.author: Hosta Seizure

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: This makes short work of 2" green wood, lops it smoothly and with not much effort - I'm in my 70's, so low effort is important! On dead 2" limbs, still quite doable but sometimes have to brace one handle on my leg and pull the other with both hands. Handles are light but strong. Nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: bumper

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lopper is nothing special. It takes too much effort to lope thick branches.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Robinson

customer_reviews.title: SO Worth the Money!!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely leave Amazon reviews, but had to for this item!! I had no idea how easy lopping thick branches could be!! This tool is now my favorite! It was so easy to use that I ended up trimming several more trees than the one I’d planned. I’m a 5’3” female and 1 1/2” diameter branches cut with very little effort, whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Jami C

product_meta.title: TABOR TOOLS GG12A Anvil Lopper with Compound Action, Chops Thick Branches with Ease, 30 Inch Tree Trimmer, Branch Cutter with 2 Inch Clean Cut Capacity.
feature_bullets: CHOPS THROUGH 2” BRANCHES effortlessly. This KING OF LOPPERS will allow for fast removal of dry and woody growth and is the ideal tool for preparatory cuts and cut-to-length work. The lopper is designed and built for professional grade applications and makes cutting dramatically easy through extra leverage and compound action power!

SHARP HARDENED CARBON STEEL BLADE will stay sharp, even after some heavy use! The low-friction non-stick coated gliding blade make every cut a joyful experience. The tools is easy to use, even for the elderly gardener or if you have arthritic wrists. There’s no cut you can’t make with this KNIGHT'S BLADE! Replacement cutting blades available.

COMFORT GRIP AND EXTRA LEVERAGE. The rubberized grips on the 22" handles provide comfort and good grip. This longer 30” model will allow you to work with some extra strength and leverage and to efficiently navigate around higher limbs. The ergonomically handles are designed for optimal grip to ease the cutting of any branch.

COMPOUND ACTION SYSTEM: The compound lever system with multiple pivot points and moving parts increases the force applied to the blades. The compound action blade has multiple moving parts which multiplies the force applied to the blades 3 times!
ORDER WITH CONFIDENCE. We at TABOR TOOLS stand behind our products. Please don’t hesitate to contact us for support, questions about our products or spare parts you might need.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,910 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
